intro: Cyclophorus stenophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cyclophorus, is a unique species of flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae, which includes a variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
